qas.question: What was the population of the urban area of Paris in 2012 without a fixed residence?
What percentage of homelessness in France does Paris house?
What percentage of homeless people are women?
How many homeless shelters are in Paris?

context: In 2012 the Paris agglomeration (urban area) counted <a0_0>28,800<a0_0/> people without a fixed residence, an increase of 84 percent since 2001; it represents <a1_0><a2_0>43<a2_0/><a1_0/> percent of the homeless in all of France. Forty-one percent were women, and 29 percent were accompanied by children. Fifty-six percent of the homeless were born outside France, the largest number coming from Africa and Eastern Europe. The city of Paris has <a3_0>sixty<a3_0/> homeless shelters, called Centres d'hébergement et de réinsertion sociale or CHRS, which are funded by <a4_0>the city<a4_0/> and operated by private charities and associations.
